content: abanicos poncho materials and tools yarn dk weight yardage 800-1000 yards in dk hook f g blocking mat and pins large darning needle to weave in ends abbreviations double_crochet = double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet skip = skip stitches chain = chain chain-space = chain space s = small m=medium l=large ** = repeat stitches between asterisks construction this is a triangular top-down seamless poncho formed by two mitred increases at the start and middle of each round each increase consists of 6dc set up chain 96 s 112 m 128 l join with slip_stitch - 1 - round 1 double_crochet around join with slip_stitch place marker at midway point on stitch 48 56 64 this is where the 2nd increase of each round will be made round 2 make 1st increase ch3 this counts as first double_crochet 5dc into the same stitch this will be the first of two increases then *ch5 skipping 3 spaces and single_crochet into the 4th stitch* repeat ** until 4 sts before marker in the marked stitch make 2nd increase consisting of 6dc continue second half of round as before *ch5 sk3 sc1* ending with ch5 and joining to 3rd chain of initial chain with a slip_stitch slip_stitch to space between 3rd and 4th double_crochet post round 3 make 1st increase ch3 5dc in between 3rd and 4th double_crochet posts then *ch5 single_crochet into next chain-space 5dc into single_crochet from previous round creating a fan single_crochet into next chain space* repeat ** until right before marker then ch5 and make 2nd increase 6dc in between 3rd and 4th double_crochet continue second half of round as before *ch5 single_crochet into next chain space 5dc into double_crochet single_crochet into next chain-space* end with ch5 and join with slip_stitch to 3rd chain of initial chain and slip_stitch to space between 3rd and 4th double_crochet post to make increase for the following round round 4 make 1st increase ch3 5dc in between 3rd and 4th double_crochet posts then *ch5 single_crochet into next chain space ch5 single_crochet into 3rd double_crochet of fan* repeat ** to marker ch5 and make 2nd increase 6dc in between 3rd and 4th double_crochet continue second half of round *ch5 single_crochet into next chain space ch5 single_crochet into 3rd double_crochet of fan* end with ch5 and join with slip_stitch to 3rd chain of initial chain and slip_stitch to space between 3rd and 4th double_crochet to make increase for the following round repeat row 3 and 4 until you reach the desired length - 2 - blocking depending on the fiber the poncho will block up to 8 wider suggested unblocked width is 12 to 18 block by folding poncho lengthwise into a symmetrical trapezoid with increase seams on either end represented below by the dashed lines you may weave blocking wires in and out of the increase row pin the top and bottom pulling until you reach the desired width --------------------------------------------------------------------- / \ / \ / \ ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- example of what stitch should look like finishing
